revised_title: Werner Rogosinski: A Life in Mathematics
tldr: This article is a biography of Werner Wolfgang Rogosinski, a prominent mathematician known for his work in analytical problems, series, and the Lebesgue integral. Born in Breslau in 1894, Rogosinski studied at various universities before joining G. H. Hardy and J. E. Littlewood in Cambridge. He made significant contributions to the fields of subharmonic functions, Fourier series, and summability. Rogosinski's work was characterized by elegance and simplicity in proofs, and he was well-respected among his peers.
